edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface ExerciseXMLHandler<E extends ExerciseData>

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidExerciseXMLHandler, XmlEncHelper
public interface ExerciseXMLHandler<E extends ExerciseData>
extends java.io.Serializable

An implementor can write a matching ExerciseData-object to a stream in predetermined (preferably) XML-format, and can also read an ExerciseData-object from a (correctly formed) stream.

Implementations must meet the constraint 

        "E".equalsSemantically(xmLHandler.read(xmLHandler.save("E"))

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Summary
 E load(java.io.InputStream inStream)
          Loads the an object of the exercise type specific ExerciseData -class from a stream.
 java.io.InputStream save(E etd)
          Saves the exercise type specific data object using the correct ExerciseData class.
 

Method Detail

save

java.io.InputStream save(E etd)
                         throws ExerciseException
Saves the exercise type specific data object using the correct ExerciseData class. Returns a stream of the (XML)-data.

Parameters:
etd - The ExerciseData sub-class representation to be saved
Returns:
InputStream to which the etd is serialized in the form determined by this class (preferably XML)
Throws:
ExerciseException - if save fails

load

E load(java.io.InputStream inStream)
                            throws ExerciseException
Loads the an object of the exercise type specific ExerciseData -class from a stream.

Parameters:
inStream - The stream from which the data is tried to be parsed
Returns:
An object of the exercise type specific ExerciseData -class
Throws:
ExerciseException - if load fails
